text: John Smith Miller House is a historic home located near Boone, Watauga County, North Carolina. It was built in 1906, and is a two-story, side gable, "L"-plan, chestnut frame I-house. It has a one-story rear ell with side porch. The front facade features a central gabled two-tier porch. It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2009. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in North Carolina Category:Houses completed in 1906 Category:Houses in Watauga County, North Carolina Category:National Register of Historic Places in Watauga County, North Carolina Category:1906 establishments in North Carolina
title: John Smith Miller House
